intro: Calchas latidens, commonly known as the broadleaf calchas, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces striking, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to thrive in moist, shaded environments. Due to habitat loss, Calchas latidens is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation areas.
